DataElement.preferredDefinition: Score for the strength of a population of Mesothelin-positive cells in a biospecimen or sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Mesothelin (630 aa, ~69 kDa) is encoded by the human MSLN gene. This protein may play a role in cellular adhesion._A thin sheet or layer of pliable tissue, serving as a covering or envelope of a part, as the lining of a cavity, as a partition or septum, or to connect two structures._The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.
